comments.body: I would simply call this `name`, but keep `resource` or `resource_name` as alias. *(Maybe this is not possible because of conflicts in that namespace ?)*

I think "name" is ambigous, as there might also be a "name" param sent into the module (which we rewrite as stated in the docs). I think it's best to avoid "name" altogether on this - and there's a very good chance someone down the line suggests to allow the "name" parameter to be passed in to the underlying dsc resource without rewriting it.

comments.body: Are you missing the always_run parameter in this or am I missing something?
hm, not sure? is that something that needs to be directly supported?

It's probably more the wording of this task, are you saying to run this in ansible_check_mode or some sort of DSC check mode? If it is the former you would need to set `check_mode: True` alongside the task but I don't see a reason why that would need to be documented here.
Ah, I think it's a copy-and-paste error from the integration tests. Good catch :-)

I'm still not quite understanding where/what's missing. There's not documentation to go on, but according to https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/ansible-devel/ba4dL-YkMiA, the only thing a Powershell-based module has to do in order to support check mode, is to indicate that using the check_mode parameter when calling "parse-args" - which my module does. Are you saying there's documentation missing?

Roughly how it implements check mode is by calling the test-targetresource DSC function and reporting the "would-be" result, but skipping the "set-targetresource" - which is the function that actually carries out the change. I'm open to improvements, just not able to completely understand what you're saying is missing/wrong.

I probably have this on the wrong line, your name for this task says `name: Invoke DSC with check mode`. If someone comes across this doc and wants to use the module in check mode they might get confused on how to do it. I'm wondering whether you had other intentions for this doc example or whether we should just update the name you have set currently.

Again, the name for that task was a copy-and-paste from the integration tests.
It would probably better to use, eg.

```yaml
    - name: Enable 'telnet-client' windows feature
```
Ah, I understand. Will fix, thanks!
So, the idea with the first test is to execute with check mode, and test that the feature is still absent- ie it tests that the module actually supports check mode and doesn't perform any changes.
I'm a tiny bit confused your description says parameters for the DSC resource says they should be prefixed with `item_` is that the case or should that be updated. Am I misunderstanding that?
only the "name" parameter needs to be prefixed. The idea was to avoid confusion with "resource_name" but maybe its a good idea accept 'name' as without any prefix instead.
Ahh that makes sense I've re-read it now and can see what you mean. I would prefer it to be just `name` to keep it consistent with the other stuff but will defer to you for the final decision.
Yup agree. I'll get that updated.
Fixed the documentation. There was some mismatch between actual module behavior and param documentation. "Name" is very much a valid parameter, if the dsc resource takes a parameter with that name.
